description.narrative: Instituto Realice will organize a network to distribute hand-crafted mercado-solidario, or Fair Trade, products through direct sales, catalogues and the Internet, and develop centers in Rio de Janeiro linking producers with vendors. Its training will ensure quality and promote the self-sufficiency of a structure that maximizes the earning potential of another 1,000 Brazilians.. Centro de Educação Popular (CENEP) will promote the use of medicinal plants indigenous to the Curimataú territory in the Brazilian Northeast and work with communities to expand on practices that apply them effectively to health care and conservation. The project is expected to benefit 350 Brazilians directly and another 2,500 residents of 10 municipalities in the state of Paraíba.. Centro de Educação Popular (CENEP) promotes the use of medicinal plants indigenous to the Curimataú territory in the Brazilian Northeast and works with communities to apply them effectively for health care and conservation. CENEP will expand project activities in the northeastern state of Paraíba, to include research on florals made with native plants from this semi-arid region of Brazil, organize the production and sales of healthy foods and expand training programs on complementary health practices. It will benefit approximately 2,350 people directly through the grant activities and another 3,500 rural inhabitants of the Curimataú region of Paraíba state.. Centro de Educação Popular (CENEP), $195,595 over two years CENEP will promote the use of medicinal plants indigenous to the Curimataú territory in the Brazilian Northeast and work with communities to expand on practices that apply them effectively to health care and conservation. description.narrative: U.S. assistance to Brazil will continue to deepen partnerships with the Government of Brazil (GOB) to make progress on shared goals, including improving regional stability by enhancing security and law-enforcement cooperation. The United States will continue to assist in the deployment of new technologies and methods in the Ministry of Health to create an AIDS-free generation. Brazilian military officials will continue to receive training that fosters closer cooperation and the ability to implement shared strategies. Brazilian and U.S. security will be enhanced by combating transnational crime, improving the rule of law, and strengthening counterterrorism programs. Under the U.S.-Brazil Joint Initiative on Climate Change signed in 2015 and the USAID-GOB Development Objective Agreement on Biodiversity Conservation signed in 2014, the United States and Brazil are pursuing cooperation on environmental priorities, including biodiversity conservation and climate change mitigation and adaptation.
Disbursement of funds to the Award Implementing Organization to carry out the activities set forth in Annex A of the grant agreement.
